text: The 1931 Washington State Cougars football team was an American football team that represented Washington State College during the 1931 college football season. Head coach Babe Hollingbery led the team to a 6–4 overall record, 4–3 in the Pacific Coast Conference (PCC). ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! scope="col" | Date ! scope="col" | Opponent ! scope="col" | Location ! scope="col" | Score ! scope="col" | Attendance |- ! scope="row" | September 26 | College of Idaho | Home | 41–0 W | 4,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 3 | UCLA | Home | 13–0 W | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 10 | USC | Away | 6–38 L | 30,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 17 | California | Portland | 7–13 L | 12,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 24 | Montana | Away | 13–0 W | 6,000 |- ! scope="row" | October 31 | Oregon State | Portland | 7–6 W | 15,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 7 | Idaho | Home | 9–8 W | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 14 | Washington | Away | 0–12 L | 30,000 |- ! scope="row" | November 21 | Gonzaga | Away | 13–6 W | 10,000 |- ! scope="row" | December 5 | Tulane | Away | 14–28 L | 20,000 |} ==References== ==External links== *Game program: UCLA at WSC – October 3, 1931 *Game program: California vs. WSC at Portland – October 10, 1931 *Game program: Idaho at WSC – November 7, 1931 Washington State Category:Washington State Cougars football seasons Category:1931 in Washington (state)
title: 1931 Washington State Cougars football team
